info.title: OneNote
info.description: Easily capture content into OneNote with this REST API.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Required: indicates type of content sent

parameters.name: sectionName
parameters.description: Optional: indicates the name of the section in the default notebook that the page should be created in. This section will be created if it does not already exist.

post.description: Creates a new page in the default notebook and section.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: true, to return the number of entities in the collection.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The filter for the query. Example: title eq 'Homework'

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description: The property to order by. Default is "lastModifiedTime desc". Example: createdTime desc

parameters.name: select
parameters.description: The properties to return. Example: title,self,createdTime

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: The number of entities to return from the result set. Default is 20, maximum is 100. Example: 10

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: The term or phrase to search for. Example: todo

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The number of entities to skip in the result set. Example: 10

get.description: Get the pages (metadata) from all notebooks in OneDrive that are owned by the user.

parameters.name: sectionId
parameters.description: Specifies the section that contains the pages.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Required: indicates type of content sent

post.description: Creates a new page in a specific section.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: true, to return the number of entities in the collection.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The filter for the query. Example: title eq 'Homework'

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description: The property to order by. Default is "lastModifiedTime desc". Example: createdTime desc

parameters.name: select
parameters.description: The properties to return. Example: title,self,createdTime

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: The number of entities to return from the result set. Default is 20, maximum is 100. Example: 10

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: The term or phrase to search for. Example: todo

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The number of entities to skip in the result set. Example: 10

get.description: Get the pages (metadata) in the specified section.

parameters.name: pageId
parameters.description: Specifies the page to delete.

parameters.name: select
parameters.description: The properties to return. Example: title,contentUrl,links

parameters.name: pageId
parameters.description: Specifies the page whose content you want to retrieve.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Required: indicates type of content returned in the response.

parameters.name: includeIDs
parameters.description: Optional: set to true to get generated IDs to use for PATCH operations.

get.description: Returns HTML content of the specified page.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Required: indicates type of content being sent

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: true, to return the number of entities in the collection.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The filter for the query. Example: createdTime ge 2015-09-01

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description: The property to order by. Default is "name asc". Example: lastModifiedTime desc

parameters.name: select
parameters.description: The properties to return. Example: name,self,links

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: The number of entities to return from the result set. Example: 10

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: The navigation properties (sections or sectionGroups) to return inline in the response. Example: sections

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The number of entities to skip in the result set. Example: 10

parameters.name: notebookId
parameters.description: Specifies the specific notebook

parameters.name: select
parameters.description: The properties to return. Example: name,sectionsUrl,links

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: The navigation properties (sections and sectionGroups) to return inline in the response. Example: sections,sectionGroups

parameters.name: notebookId
parameters.description: Specifies the notebook.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Required: indicates type of content being sent

post.description: Creates a new section in a specific notebook.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: true, to return the number of entities in the collection.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The filter for the query. Example: createdTime ge 2015-09-01

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description: The property to order by. Default is "name asc". Example: lastModifiedTime desc

parameters.name: select
parameters.description: The properties to return. Example: name,pagesUrl,createdTime

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: The number of entities to return from the result set. Example: 10

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: The navigation properties (parentNotebook or parentSectionGroup) to return inline in the response. The default query expands parentNotebook and parentSectionGroup, and selects their id, name, and self properties.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The number of entities to skip in the result set. Example: 10

get.description: Returns a collection of sections within a specific notebook.

parameters.name: notebookId
parameters.description: Specifies the notebook.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: true, to return the number of entities in the collection.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The filter for the query. Example: createdTime ge 2015-09-01

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description: The property to order by. Default is "name asc". Example: lastModifiedTime desc

parameters.name: select
parameters.description: The properties to return. Example: name,sectionsUrl,createdTime

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: The number of entities to return from the result set. Example: 10

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: The navigation properties (sections, sectionGroups, parentNotebook, or parentSectionGroup) to return inline in the response. The default query expands parentNotebook and parentSectionGroup, and selects their id, name, and self properties.  Example: sections,sectionGroups

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The number of entities to skip in the result set. Example: 10

get.description: Returns a collection of section groups within a specific notebook.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: true, to return the number of entities in the collection.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The filter for the query. Example: createdTime ge 2015-09-01

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description: The property to order by. Default is "name asc". Example: lastModifiedTime desc

parameters.name: select
parameters.description: The properties to return. Example: name,sectionsUrl,createdTime

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: The number of entities to return from the result set. Example: 10

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: The navigation properties (sections, sectionGroups, parentNotebook, or parentSectionGroup) to return inline in the response. The default query expands parentNotebook and parentSectionGroup, and selects their id, name, and self properties.  Example: sections,sectionGroups

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The number of entities to skip in the result set. Example: 10

get.description: Returns a collection of section groups.

parameters.name: sectionGroupId
parameters.description: Specifies the specific section group

parameters.name: select
parameters.description: The properties to return. Example: name,sectionsUrl,createdTime

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: The navigation properties (sections, sectionGroups, parentNotebook, or parentSectionGroup) to return inline in the response. Example: sections,parentNotebook

get.description: Returns a specific section group object.

parameters.name: sectionGroupId
parameters.description: Specifies the section group.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: true, to return the number of entities in the collection.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The filter for the query. Example: createdTime ge 2015-09-01

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description: The property to order by. Default is "name asc". Example: lastModifiedTime desc

parameters.name: select
parameters.description: The properties to return. Example: name,pagesUrl,createdTime

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: The number of entities to return from the result set. Example: 10

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: The navigation properties (parentNotebook or parentSectionGroup) to return inline in the response. The default query expands parentNotebook and parentSectionGroup, and selects their id, name, and self properties.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The number of entities to skip in the result set. Example: 10

get.description: Returns a collection of sections within a specific section group.

parameters.name: sectionGroupId
parameters.description: Specifies the section group.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: true, to return the number of entities in the collection.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The filter for the query. Example: createdTime ge 2015-09-01

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description: The property to order by. Default is "name asc". Example: lastModifiedTime desc

parameters.name: select
parameters.description: The properties to return. Example: name,sectionsUrl,createdTime

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: The number of entities to return from the result set. Example: 10

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: The navigation properties (sections, sectionGroups, parentNotebook, or parentSectionGroup) to return inline in the response. The default query expands parentNotebook and parentSectionGroup, and selects their id, name, and self properties.  Example: sections,sectionGroups

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The number of entities to skip in the result set. Example: 10

get.description: Returns a collection of section groups within a specific section group.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: true, to return the number of entities in the collection.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The filter for the query. Example: createdTime ge 2015-09-01

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description: The property to order by. Default is "name asc". Example: lastModifiedTime desc

parameters.name: select
parameters.description: The properties to return. Example: name,pagesUrl,createdTime

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: The number of entities to return from the result set. Example: 10

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: The navigation properties (parentNotebook or parentSectionGroup) to return inline in the response. The default query expands parentNotebook and parentSectionGroup, and selects their id, name, and self properties.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The number of entities to skip in the result set. Example: 10

parameters.name: sectionId
parameters.description: Specifies the specific Section

parameters.name: select
parameters.description: The properties to return. Example: name,pagesUrl,createdTime

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: The navigation properties (parentNotebook, or parentSectionGroup) to return inline in the response. Example: parentNotebook
